section.p: This entry is a specialization of the Concern Entry, wherein the subject of the concern is focused on an allergy or intolerance.

ol.li: SHALL conform to IHE Concern Entry template (templateId: 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.5.3.1.4.5.1)
SHALL conform to CDA Clinical Statement
SHALL conform to CDA Act
SHALL conform to CCD Problem Act template (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.27)
SHALL conform to IHE Concern Entry template (templateId: 1.3.6.1.4.1.19376.1.5.3.1.4.5.1)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode = "ACT" (CONF-146)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode = "EVN" (CONF-147)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code/@nullFlavor = "NA" NA (not applicable) (CONF-149)
SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF-148)

SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] effectiveTime
The effectiveTime element records the starting and ending times during which the concern was active.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode, which SHALL be selected from ConcernEntryStatus Value Set

MAY contain exactly one [1..1] entryRelationship, such that it
contains CCD Episode Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.41) (CONF-168)

Contains zero or more [0..*] entryRelationship, such that it
contains CCD Problem Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.28)
SHALL satisfy: Contains one or more entryRelationship (CONF-151)

MAY satisfy: A problem act MAY reference a problem observation, alert observation (see section Alerts) or other clinical statement that is the subject of concern, by setting the value for "Act / entryRelationship / @typeCode" to be "SUBJ" 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1002 ActRelationshipType STATIC. (CONF-152)

SHOULD satisfy: The target of a problem act with Act / entryRelationship / @typeCode="SUBJ" SHOULD be a problem observation (in the Problem section) or alert observation (in the Alert section), but MAY be some other clinical statement. (CONF-153)
SHOULD satisfy: In Problem Section, a Problem Act SHOULD contain one or more Problem Observations. (CONF-140)
SHOULD satisfy: In Alert Section, a ProblemAct SHOULD contain one or more Alert Observations. (CONF-256)
MAY satisfy: Contains exactly one Patient Awareness (CONF-179)
SHALL satisfy: The effectiveTime 'low' element shall be present. The 'high' element shall be present for concerns in the completed or aborted state, and shall not be present otherwise.

SHALL satisfy: Each concern is about one or more related problems or allergies. This entry shall contain one or more problem or allergy entries that conform to the specification in section Problem Entry or Allergies and Intolerances. This is how a series of related observations can be grouped as a single concern. This SHALL be represented using entryRelationship with typeCode = 'SUBJ'.

MAY satisfy: Each concern may have 0 or more related references. These may be used to represent related statements such related visits. This may be any valid CDA clinical statement, and SHOULD be an IHE entry template. This SHALL be represented using entryRelationship with typeCode = 'REFR'.
